thread.title: Spain eyes 0.8% growth in Q3
thread.title_full: Spain eyes 0.8% growth in Q3 | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: Spain eyes 0.8% growth in Q3
text:
Spain's economy is likely to grow 0.8 per cent in the third quarter from the second, its central bank said on Wednesday, as low oil prices and borrowing costs remain supportive ahead of December's general election.
In a monthly review of the eurozone's fourth-largest economy, the Bank of Spain said the annual rate of growth is likely to be 3.4 per cent in the quarter, with strong domestic demand more than offsetting a negative contribution from external trade, amid a slowdown in exports due to weaker global demand.
The central bank cited lower economic growth in China as a source of uncertainty for Spain. It added that the latest dip in oil prices has driven an annual drop in consumer prices in August and September, which indicates an anticipated stabilisation of prices after a long period of mild disinflation will take longer than previously expected.
The country's consumer price index is likely to increase slightly on the year by December, but it should average a 0.5 per cent decrease for the whole of 2015, the central bank said.
